title.en: Biographies of Lian Po and Lin Xiangru
title.raw: 《廉頗藺相如列傳》 Biographies of Lian Po and Lin Xiangru

sentences.zh: 廉頗者，趙之良將也。

translations.literal: Lian Po was Zhao good general.
translations.idiomatic: Lian Po was Zhao's good general.

sentences.zh: 趙惠文王十六年，廉頗為趙將伐齊，大破之，取陽晉，拜為上卿，以勇氣聞於諸侯。

translations.literal: During Zhao King Huiwen's time, they obtained the jade disk of Chu's He family. Qin King Zhao heard of this and sent someone with a letter to Zhao king, wishing to exchange fifteen cities for the jade disk. The Zhao king consulted with grand general Lian Po and the ministers: wishing to give it to Qin, fearing the cities could not be obtained, only being deceived; Wishing not to give it, then worried about Qin's troops coming. The plan undecided, they sought someone who could be sent to reply to Qin, but none found. Eunuch director Miao Xian said: 'My retainer Lin Xiangru can be sent.' The king asked: 'How do you know this?' He replied: 'I once committed a crime and secretly planned to flee to Yan. My retainer Xiangru stopped me, saying: "How do you know the Yan king?"' I told him: "I once accompanied the great king to meet the Yan king at the border. The Yan king privately grasped my hand, saying 'I wish to befriend you'." With this I know him, thus wished to go.' Xiangru told me: 'Zhao is strong and Yan weak, and you are favored by the Zhao king, thus the Yan king wishes to befriend you. Now you flee Zhao for Yan, Yan fears Zhao, the situation certainly dares not keep you, but will bind you and return you to Zhao.' You should rather expose your flesh and submit to the axe to beg forgiveness, then fortunately escape.' I followed his plan, the great king also fortunately pardoned me. I secretly consider him a brave man with wisdom and strategy, suitable to send.' Thus the king summoned and saw Lin Xiangru, asking: 'The Qin king wishes to exchange fifteen cities for my jade disk. Should I give it or not?' Xiangru said: 'Qin is strong and Zhao weak, cannot but agree.' The king said: 'If they take my jade disk but not give me cities, what then?' Xiangru said: 'If Qin seeks the jade disk with cities but Zhao does not agree, the fault lies with Zhao.' If Zhao gives the jade disk but Qin does not give Zhao cities, the fault lies with Qin.' Between these two strategies, better to agree and let Qin bear the fault.' The king said: 'Who can be sent?' Xiangru said: 'If Your Majesty has no one, I wish to carry the jade disk and go as envoy.' If cities enter Zhao, the jade disk stays in Qin; If cities do not enter, I beg to return the intact jade disk to Zhao.' The Zhao king thus sent Xiangru carrying the jade disk west into Qin.

translations.literal: The Qin king sat at Zhangtai to receive Xiangru. Xiangru presented the jade disk to the Qin king. The Qin king was greatly pleased, passed it to show the beauties and attendants. The attendants all called ten thousand years. Xiangru saw the Qin king had no intention of paying Zhao cities, thus stepped forward saying: 'The jade disk has a flaw, please let me show Your Majesty.' The king gave the jade disk. Xiangru thus held the jade disk and stepped back, leaning against a pillar, his hair bristling and lifting his hat, telling the Qin king: 'Your Majesty wished to obtain the jade disk, sent people with letters to the Zhao king. The Zhao king summoned all ministers to discuss, all saying "Qin is greedy, relying on its strength, seeking the jade disk with empty words, fearing the cities cannot be obtained."' The discussion did not wish to give Qin the jade disk. I considered that even commoners' friendships do not deceive each other, how much more great states! Moreover, for one jade disk's sake to offend strong Qin's favor is unacceptable. Thus the Zhao king purified himself for five days, sent me carrying the jade disk, bowing to send the letter in the court. Why? To honor the great state's prestige and show respect. Now I arrive, Your Majesty receives me in the side hall, the etiquette very arrogant. Obtaining the jade disk, passing it to beauties to play with and mock me. I see Your Majesty has no intention of paying Zhao king cities, thus I take back the jade disk. If Your Majesty wishes to force me, my head today will shatter with the jade disk against the pillar!' Xiangru held the jade disk glaring at the pillar, wishing to smash it. The Qin king feared he would break the jade disk, thus apologized profusely and earnestly requested, summoned officials to spread maps, pointing out from here onward fifteen commanderies to give Zhao. Xiangru judged the Qin king only used deceitful display to give Zhao cities, truly unobtainable, thus told the Qin king: 'The He family jade disk is a treasure transmitted by the world. The Zhao king feared, dared not not offer it.' When the Zhao king sent the jade disk, he purified himself five days. Now Your Majesty should also purify himself five days, set the nine-rank court in the hall, then I dare present the jade disk.' The Qin king considered it, ultimately could not forcibly seize, thus agreed to purify five days, housed Xiangru in Guangcheng hostel. Xiangru judged though the Qin king purified, he would certainly break the agreement not pay cities, thus had his followers dress in coarse cloth, hide the jade disk in their robes, escape by byways, return the jade disk to Zhao.

Better to treat him generously and let him return to Zhao. Would the Zhao king for one jade disk's sake deceive Qin?' Ultimately he received Xiangru in court, completed the rites and returned him.

translations.literal: Qin king sent envoy inform Zhao king, wished with king make friendly meeting at west river outside Mianchi pool.
translations.idiomatic: The Qin king sent an envoy to inform the Zhao king, proposing a friendly summit meeting at Mianchi Pool outside the west river.

sentences.zh: 趙王畏秦，欲毋行。

translations.literal: Zhao king feared Qin, wished not go.
translations.idiomatic: The Zhao king feared Qin and wanted to decline.

sentences.zh: 廉頗、藺相如計曰：「王不行，示趙弱且怯也。」

translations.literal: Lian Po, Lin Xiangru planned said: 'King not go, shows Zhao weak and cowardly.'
translations.idiomatic: Lian Po and Lin Xiangru counseled: 'If the king doesn't go, it will show Zhao as weak and cowardly.'

sentences.zh: 趙王遂行，相如從。

translations.literal: Zhao king thus went, Xiangru followed.
translations.idiomatic: So the Zhao king went, accompanied by Xiangru.

sentences.zh: 廉頗送至境，與王訣曰：「王行，度道里會遇之禮畢，還，不過三十日。

translations.literal: Lian Po sent to border, with king parted said: 'King goes, measure distance meeting encounter ceremony finished, return, not more than thirty days.
translations.idiomatic: Lian Po escorted him to the border and bade farewell, saying: 'Your Majesty goes. Considering the distance and protocol of the meeting, you should return within thirty days at most.

sentences.zh: 三十日不還，則請立太子為王。

translations.literal: Thirty days not return, then please establish crown prince as king.
translations.idiomatic: If you don't return in thirty days, I beg you to establish the crown prince as king.

sentences.zh: 以絕秦望。」

translations.literal: To cut off Qin hopes.'
translations.idiomatic: To dash Qin's hopes.'

sentences.zh: 王許之，遂與秦王會澠池。

translations.literal: King allowed it, thus with Qin king met at Mianchi pool.
translations.idiomatic: The king agreed, and thus met with the Qin king at Mianchi Pool.

sentences.zh: 秦王飲酒酣，曰：「寡人竊聞趙王好音，請奏瑟。」

translations.literal: Qin king drank wine tipsy, said: 'I secretly heard Zhao king likes music, please play zither.'
translations.idiomatic: The Qin king, drunk on wine, said: 'I hear the Zhao king loves music. Please play the zither.'

sentences.zh: 趙王鼓瑟。

translations.literal: Zhao king played zither.
translations.idiomatic: The Zhao king played the zither.

sentences.zh: 秦御史前書曰「某年月日，秦王與趙王會飲，令趙王鼓瑟」。

translations.literal: Qin secretary went forward wrote said 'certain year month day, Qin king with Zhao king met drank, ordered Zhao king play zither'.
translations.idiomatic: The Qin scribe stepped forward and recorded: 'On such-and-such date, the Qin king and Zhao king met and drank together, commanding the Zhao king to play the zither.'

sentences.zh: 藺相如前曰：「趙王竊聞秦王善為秦聲，請奏盆缻秦王，以相娛樂。」

translations.literal: Lin Xiangru went forward said: 'Zhao king secretly heard Qin king skilled at Qin music, please strike basin for Qin king, to mutually entertain.'
translations.idiomatic: Lin Xiangru stepped forward and said: 'The Zhao king hears that the Qin king is skilled in Qin music. Please strike the chime stones for the Qin king to provide mutual entertainment.'

sentences.zh: 秦王怒，不許。

translations.literal: Qin king angered, not allowed.
translations.idiomatic: The Qin king flew into a rage and refused.

sentences.zh: 於是相如前進缻，因跪請秦王。

translations.literal: Thus Xiangru forward advanced chime stones, thus knelt requested Qin king.
translations.idiomatic: Thus Xiangru stepped forward with the chime stones and knelt to request the Qin king.

sentences.zh: 秦王不肯擊缻。

translations.literal: Qin king not willing strike chime stones.
translations.idiomatic: The Qin king refused to strike the chime stones.

sentences.zh: 相如曰：「五步之內，相如請得以頸血濺大王矣！」

translations.literal: Xiangru said: 'Within five steps, Xiangru begs to be able to spatter great king with neck blood!'
translations.idiomatic: Xiangru said: 'Within five paces, I beg to spatter Your Majesty with the blood from my neck!'

sentences.zh: 左右欲刃相如，相如張目叱之，左右皆靡。

translations.literal: Attendants wished blade Xiangru, Xiangru opened eyes berated them, attendants all scattered.
translations.idiomatic: The attendants wanted to stab Xiangru, but Xiangru glared and berated them, and the attendants all retreated in fear.

sentences.zh: 於是秦王不懌，為一擊缻。

translations.literal: Thus Qin king displeased, made one strike chime stones.
translations.idiomatic: Thus the Qin king, displeased, reluctantly struck the chime stones once.

sentences.zh: 相如顧召趙御史書曰「某年月日，秦王為趙王擊缻」。

translations.literal: Xiangru turned summoned Zhao scribe wrote said 'certain year month day, Qin king for Zhao king struck chime stones'.
translations.idiomatic: Xiangru turned and summoned the Zhao scribe to record: 'On such-and-such date, the Qin king struck the chime stones for the Zhao king.'

sentences.zh: 秦之群臣曰：「請以趙十五城為秦王壽」。

translations.literal: Qin's ministers said: 'Please offer Zhao fifteen cities as congratulations to Qin king.'
translations.idiomatic: Qin's ministers said: 'Please offer fifteen Zhao cities in congratulations to the Qin king.'

sentences.zh: 藺相如亦曰：「請以秦之咸陽為趙王壽。」

translations.literal: Lin Xiangru also said: 'Please offer Qin Xianyang as congratulations to Zhao king.'
translations.idiomatic: Lin Xiangru also said: 'Please offer Qin's Xianyang in congratulations to the Zhao king.'

sentences.zh: 秦王竟酒，終不能加勝於趙。

translations.literal: Qin king finished wine, ultimately could not gain victory over Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: The Qin king finished the wine, but ultimately could gain no advantage over Zhao.

sentences.zh: 趙亦盛設兵以待秦，秦不敢動。

translations.literal: Zhao also abundantly set up troops to wait for Qin, Qin dared not move.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao also massed troops in readiness for Qin, and Qin dared not make a move.

translations.literal: The Qin king sent envoys to tell the Zhao king, wishing to hold a friendly meeting with the king outside Xhe at Mianchi. The Zhao king feared Qin, wished not to go. Lian Po and Lin Xiangru planned: 'If Your Majesty does not go, it shows Zhao weak and cowardly.' The Zhao king thus went, Xiangru following. Lian Po escorted to the border, took leave of the king saying: 'Your Majesty goes, measuring the road distance, the meeting etiquette finished, return, no more than thirty days.' If thirty days not returned, then please establish the crown prince as king. To cut off Qin's hopes.' The king agreed, thus met the Qin king at Mianchi. The Qin king drank wine freely, said: 'I privately heard the Zhao king likes music, please play the zither.' The Zhao king played the zither. The Qin scribe stepped forward writing: 'Such year month day, Qin king and Zhao king met drinking, ordered Zhao king to play zither.' Lin Xiangru stepped forward saying: 'The Zhao king privately heard the Qin king is skilled at Qin music, please play the basin for the Qin king, to entertain each other.' The Qin king angered, did not agree. Thus Xiangru stepped forward with the basin, knelt requesting the Qin king. The Qin king refused to strike the basin. Xiangru said: 'Within five paces, Xiangru begs to splash Your Majesty with my neck blood!' The attendants wished to attack Xiangru, Xiangru glared and berated them, the attendants all retreated. Thus the Qin king displeased, struck the basin once. Xiangru turned and summoned the Zhao scribe to write: 'Such year month day, Qin king struck basin for Zhao king.' Qin's ministers said: 'Please offer Zhao's fifteen cities as toast to the Qin king.' Lin Xiangru also said: 'Please offer Qin's Xianyang as toast to the Zhao king.' The Qin king finished drinking, ultimately could not gain advantage over Zhao. Zhao also massed troops ready for Qin, Qin dared not move.

sentences.zh: 既罷歸國，以相如功大，拜為上卿，位在廉頗之右。

translations.literal: Having finished returned to country, because Xiangru merit great, appointed as upper minister, position to right of Lian Po.
translations.idiomatic: After the banquet ended and they returned home, because of Xiangru's great merit, he was appointed upper minister, ranking above Lian Po.

sentences.zh: 廉頗曰：「我為趙將，有攻城野戰之大功，而藺相如徒以口舌為勞，而位居我上，且相如素賤人，吾羞，不忍為之下。」

translations.literal: Lian Po said: 'I as Zhao general, have great merit of attacking cities fighting in fields, but Lin Xiangru only with tongue as labor, yet position above me, moreover Xiangru originally lowly person, I ashamed, cannot bear to be below him.'
translations.idiomatic: Lian Po said: 'I am Zhao's general with great merits from attacking cities and fighting in the field, yet Lin Xiangru has only labored with words, yet ranks above me. Moreover, Xiangru was originally a lowly person. I am ashamed and cannot bear to be beneath him.'

sentences.zh: 宣言曰：「我見相如，必辱之。」

translations.literal: Declared saying: 'I see Xiangru, certainly humiliate him.'
translations.idiomatic: He declared: 'When I see Xiangru, I will certainly humiliate him.'

sentences.zh: 相如聞，不肯與會。

translations.literal: Xiangru heard, not willing to meet with him.
translations.idiomatic: Xiangru heard this and refused to meet with him.

sentences.zh: 相如每朝時，常稱病，不欲與廉頗爭列。

translations.literal: Xiangru every morning time, often claimed illness, not wishing to contend rank with Lian Po.
translations.idiomatic: Whenever court was held, Xiangru would often claim illness, not wishing to contend in rank with Lian Po.

sentences.zh: 已而相如出，望見廉頗，相如引車避匿。

translations.literal: Soon after Xiangru went out, saw Lian Po from afar, Xiangru drew carriage aside hid.
translations.idiomatic: Soon after, when Xiangru went out and spotted Lian Po from afar, he steered his carriage aside to avoid him.

sentences.zh: 於是舍人相與諫曰：「臣所以去親戚而事君者，徒慕君之高義也。

translations.literal: Thus retainers together admonished said: 'We who left relatives to serve lord, only admired lord's noble righteousness.
translations.idiomatic: Thus his retainers together admonished him: 'We who left our families to serve you did so only because we admired your noble righteousness.

sentences.zh: 今君與廉頗同列，廉君宣惡言而君畏匿之，恐懼殊甚，且庸人尚羞之，況於將相乎！

translations.literal: Now lord with Lian Po same rank, Lian Jun proclaimed evil words but lord fears hides from him, fear extremely great, moreover even common people still ashamed of it, moreover for generals and ministers!
translations.idiomatic: Now you and Lian Po hold the same rank, yet he proclaims vile words and you fearfully hide from him. Your fear is extreme! Even common people would be ashamed of this, much less generals and ministers!'

sentences.zh: 臣等不肖，請辭去。」

translations.literal: We unworthy, please take leave.'
translations.idiomatic: We are unworthy and request to take our leave.'

sentences.zh: 藺相如固止之，曰：「公之視廉將軍孰與秦王？」

translations.literal: Lin Xiangru firmly stopped them, said: 'Sirs view Lian general compared to Qin king which greater?'
translations.idiomatic: Lin Xiangru firmly stopped them and said: 'Gentlemen, in your view, how does General Lian compare to the Qin king?'

sentences.zh: 曰：「不若也。」

translations.literal: Said: 'Not as great.'
translations.idiomatic: They replied: 'He is not as formidable.'

sentences.zh: 相如曰：「夫以秦王之威，而相如廷叱之，辱其群臣，相如雖駑，獨畏廉將軍哉？

translations.literal: Xiangru said: 'With Qin king might, yet Xiangru in court berated him, humiliated his ministers, Xiangru though lowly, alone fears Lian general?
translations.idiomatic: Xiangru said: 'With all the Qin king's power, I berated him in his own court and humiliated his ministers. Though I am lowly, would I alone fear General Lian?'

sentences.zh: 顧吾念之，彊秦之所以不敢加兵於趙者，徒以吾兩人在也。

translations.literal: But I think of it, strong Qin reason dares not add troops to Zhao, only because our two persons are there.
translations.idiomatic: But I consider this: the only reason mighty Qin dares not attack Zhao is because we two men are here.

sentences.zh: 今兩虎共鬬，其勢不俱生。

translations.literal: Now two tigers together fight, their situation cannot both live.
translations.idiomatic: Now if two tigers fight, they cannot both survive.

sentences.zh: 吾所以為此者，以先國家之急而後私讎也。」

translations.literal: My reason for doing this, is to put national crisis first and private enmity second.'
translations.idiomatic: The reason I do this is to put the nation's crisis before private grudges.'

sentences.zh: 廉頗聞之，肉袒負荊，因賓客至藺相如門謝罪。

translations.literal: Lian Po heard this, bared body carried thorns, through guests went to Lin Xiangru gate to apologize.
translations.idiomatic: When Lian Po heard this, he bared his back, carried thorns on his shoulders, and went through the guests to Lin Xiangru's gate to apologize.

sentences.zh: 曰：「鄙賤之人，不知將軍寬之至此也。」

translations.literal: Said: 'Lowly base person, did not know general's magnanimity reached to this.'
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'This base and lowly person did not know the general's magnanimity extended to this degree.'

sentences.zh: 卒相與驩，為刎頸之交。

translations.literal: Finally together harmonious, became neck-cutting friendship.
translations.idiomatic: In the end they were reconciled and became friends who would die for each other.

translations.literal: Having ended and returned home, because Xiangru's merit great, appointed upper minister, position above Lian Po. Lian Po said: 'I serve as Zhao general, have great merit of attacking cities and field battles, yet Lin Xiangru only labors with words, yet position above me. Moreover Xiangru originally base person, I ashamed, cannot bear being below him.' He declared: 'If I see Xiangru, I will humiliate him.' Xiangru heard, refused to meet him. Xiangru at court always claimed illness, did not wish to contend with Lian Po for position. Afterward Xiangru went out, saw Lian Po from afar, Xiangru turned his chariot to hide. Thus his retainers together admonished: 'We left families and relatives to serve Your Lordship, only admiring Your Lordship's noble righteousness.' Now Your Lordship and Lian Po same rank, Lian openly speaks ill and Your Lordship fears and hides, fear extremely great. Even common people still ashamed of this, how much more ministers and generals! We unworthy, beg to resign.' Lin Xiangru firmly stopped them, saying: 'You consider Lian general compared to Qin king, who stronger?' They said: 'Not as good.' Xiangru said: 'With the Qin king's prestige, yet Xiangru berated him in court, humiliated his ministers. Though Xiangru cowardly, how fear Lian general alone?' I consider it: Strong Qin dares not use troops against Zhao, only because we two are there.' Now two tigers fight together, their situation cannot both survive.' I do this to put the state's urgency first and private enmity second.' Lian Po heard of this, exposed his flesh and carried thorns on his back, came through the retainers to Lin Xiangru's gate to apologize. Saying: 'This base person did not know the general's magnanimity reached this extent.' Ultimately they became harmonious, forming the friendship of cutting necks.

sentences.zh: 是歲，廉頗東攻齊，破其一軍。

translations.literal: This year, Lian Po east attacked Qi, broke one of their armies.
translations.idiomatic: That year, Lian Po attacked Qi to the east and defeated one of their armies.

sentences.zh: 居二年，廉頗復伐齊幾，拔之。

translations.literal: After two years, Lian Po again attacked Qi Ji, took it.
translations.idiomatic: Two years later, Lian Po again attacked the Qi city of Ji and captured it.

sentences.zh: 後三年，廉頗攻魏之防陵、安陽，拔之。

translations.literal: After three years, Lian Po attacked Wei's Fangling, Anyang, took them.
translations.idiomatic: Three years later, Lian Po attacked Wei's Fangling and Anyang and captured them.

sentences.zh: 後四年，藺相如將而攻齊，至平邑而罷。

translations.literal: After four years, Lin Xiangru as general attacked Qi, reached Pingyi and stopped.
translations.idiomatic: Four years later, Lin Xiangru led troops to attack Qi, reaching Pingyi before halting.

sentences.zh: 其明年，趙奢破秦軍閼與下。

translations.literal: The next year, Zhao She broke Qin army at Yan and below.
translations.idiomatic: The following year, Zhao She defeated the Qin army at Yan.

translations.literal: This year, Lian Po attacked Qi east, breaking one of their armies. Two years later, Lian Po again attacked Qi's Ji, capturing it. Three years later, Lian Po attacked Wei's Fangling and Anyang, capturing them. Four years later, Lin Xiangru led and attacked Qi, reaching Pingyi then stopped. The next year, Zhao She broke the Qin army below Yan.

sentences.zh: 趙奢者，趙之田部吏也。

translations.literal: Zhao She was Zhao's tax collection official.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao She was a tax collector in Zhao.

sentences.zh: 收租稅而平原君家不肯出趙，奢以法治之，殺平原君用事者九人。

translations.literal: Collected taxes but Pingyuan Jun household refused to pay Zhao taxes, She used law to handle it, killed nine of Pingyuan Jun's influential retainers.
translations.idiomatic: While collecting taxes, he found that Lord Pingyuan's household refused to pay Zhao's taxes. She enforced the law and executed nine of Lord Pingyuan's influential retainers.

sentences.zh: 平原君怒，將殺奢。

translations.literal: Pingyuan Jun angered, would kill She.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Pingyuan was furious and wanted to kill him.

sentences.zh: 奢因說曰：「君於趙為貴公子，今縱君家而不奉公則法削，法削則國弱，國弱則諸侯加兵，諸侯加兵是無趙也，君安得有此富乎？

translations.literal: She thus persuaded said: 'Lord in Zhao is noble son, now if indulge lord household not serve public then law weakened, law weakened then state weak, state weak then feudal lords add troops, feudal lords add troops means no Zhao, lord how obtain this wealth?
translations.idiomatic: She then persuaded him: 'You are a noble lord in Zhao. If you indulge your household and don't serve the public, the law will be weakened. Weakened law means a weak state, and a weak state invites attacks from other lords. When other lords attack, Zhao will perish. How then could you maintain your wealth?'

sentences.zh: 以君之貴，奉公如法則上下平，上下平則國彊，國彊則趙固，而君為貴戚，豈輕於天下邪？」

translations.literal: With lord's nobility, serve public as law then superiors inferiors equal, superiors inferiors equal then state strong, state strong then Zhao secure, and lord as noble relative, how light in world?'
translations.idiomatic: With your noble status, if you serve the public according to the law, superiors and inferiors will be equal. Equal superiors and inferiors means a strong state, and a strong state secures Zhao. As a noble relative, would you be insignificant in the world?'

sentences.zh: 平原君以為賢，言之於王。

translations.literal: Pingyuan Jun considered him worthy, spoke of him to the king.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Pingyuan considered him worthy and recommended him to the king.

sentences.zh: 王用之治國賦，國賦大平，民富而府庫實。

translations.literal: King used him to manage state revenues, state revenues greatly fair, people rich and treasuries full.
translations.idiomatic: The king employed him to manage state finances, and revenues became very fair. The people grew wealthy and the treasuries filled.

translations.literal: Zhao She was a tax collector of Zhao. Collecting rents and taxes, the Lord Pingyuan household refused to pay. She enforced the law against them, killing nine of Lord Pingyuan's influential retainers. Lord Pingyuan angered, wished to kill She. She thus advised: 'You in Zhao are a noble lord. Now if your household violates and does not serve the public, then law diminished. Law diminished then state weak. State weak then feudal lords attack. Feudal lords attack means no Zhao. How can you have this wealth? With your nobility, serving the public according to law then superiors and inferiors equal. Superiors and inferiors equal then state strong. State strong then Zhao secure, and you noble relative—how slight compared to the world?' Lord Pingyuan considered him worthy, spoke of him to the king. The king used him to manage state revenues. State revenues greatly balanced, people rich and treasuries full.

sentences.zh: 秦伐韓，軍於閼與。

translations.literal: Qin attacked Han, army at Yan.
translations.idiomatic: Qin attacked Han and positioned their army at Yan.

sentences.zh: 王召廉頗而問曰：「可救不？」

translations.literal: King summoned Lian Po and asked: 'Can save not?'
translations.idiomatic: The king summoned Lian Po and asked: 'Can we save them?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「道遠險狹，難救。」

translations.literal: Replied: 'Road far dangerous narrow, difficult save.'
translations.idiomatic: He replied: 'The road is long and treacherous. It would be difficult to save them.'

sentences.zh: 又召樂乘而問焉，樂乘對如廉頗言。

translations.literal: Again summoned Yue Cheng and asked him, Yue Cheng replied like Lian Po said.
translations.idiomatic: He then summoned Yue Cheng and asked him the same question. Yue Cheng replied just as Lian Po had.

sentences.zh: 又召問趙奢，奢對曰：「其道遠險狹，譬之猶兩鼠鬬於穴中，將勇者勝。」

translations.literal: Again summoned asked Zhao She, She replied: 'Its road far dangerous narrow, analogous to two rats fighting in hole, brave general win.'
translations.idiomatic: Then he summoned Zhao She and asked him. She replied: 'The road is long and treacherous, like two rats fighting in a hole - the braver general will win.'

sentences.zh: 王乃令趙奢將，救之。

translations.literal: King then ordered Zhao She to lead, save them.
translations.idiomatic: The king then ordered Zhao She to lead troops and save them.

translations.literal: Qin attacked Han, encamped at Yan. The king summoned Lian Po and asked: 'Can we rescue?' He replied: 'The road distant and narrow, difficult to rescue.' Again summoned Le Cheng and asked, Le Cheng replied like Lian Po. Again summoned and asked Zhao She. She replied: 'The road distant and narrow, like two rats fighting in a hole—the braver will win.' The king thus ordered Zhao She to lead, rescue them.

sentences.zh: 兵去邯鄲三十里，而令軍中曰：「有以軍事諫者死。」

translations.literal: Troops left Handan thirty li, and ordered in army: 'Anyone who advises on military matters dies.'
translations.idiomatic: The troops had marched thirty li from Handan when he ordered the army: 'Anyone who offers military advice will be executed.'

sentences.zh: 秦軍軍武安西，秦軍鼓譟勒兵，武安屋瓦盡振。

translations.literal: Qin army camped west of Wuan, Qin army beat drums roared prepared troops, Wuan roof tiles all shook.
translations.idiomatic: The Qin army camped west of Wuan. The Qin troops beat their drums, roared battle cries, and prepared for battle, causing all the roof tiles in Wuan to shake.

sentences.zh: 軍中候有一人言急救武安，趙奢立斬之。

translations.literal: Army officer had one person speak urgently save Wuan, Zhao She immediately beheaded him.
translations.idiomatic: An officer in the army urged urgently to save Wuan, but Zhao She immediately executed him.

sentences.zh: 堅壁，留二十八日不行，復益增壘。

translations.literal: Strengthened walls, stayed twenty-eight days not advance, moreover further increased fortifications.
translations.idiomatic: He strengthened the defensive walls and remained there twenty-eight days without advancing, further reinforcing the fortifications.

sentences.zh: 秦閒來入，趙奢善食而遣之。

translations.literal: Qin spy came enter, Zhao She well fed him and sent him away.
translations.idiomatic: A Qin spy came to infiltrate, but Zhao She fed him well and sent him on his way.

sentences.zh: 閒以報秦將，秦將大喜曰：「夫去國三十里而軍不行，乃增壘，閼與非趙地也。」

translations.literal: Spy reported to Qin general, Qin general greatly delighted said: 'Having left capital thirty li yet army not advance, moreover increases fortifications, Yan is not Zhao territory.'
translations.idiomatic: The spy reported back to the Qin general, who was greatly delighted and said: 'They've marched thirty li from their capital yet don't advance. They're just reinforcing fortifications. Yan isn't even Zhao territory!'

sentences.zh: 趙奢既已遣秦閒，卷甲而趨之，二日一夜至，今善射者去閼與五十里而軍。

translations.literal: Zhao She having sent away Qin spy, rolled up armor and hurried to it, two days one night arrived, ordered good archers to go fifty li from Yan and camp.
translations.idiomatic: Once Zhao She had sent the Qin spy away, he had his troops roll up their armor and march swiftly. They arrived in two days and one night, and he ordered the best archers to camp fifty li from Yan.

sentences.zh: 軍壘成，秦人聞之，悉甲而至。

translations.literal: Army fortifications completed, Qin people heard, all armored and came.
translations.idiomatic: Once the fortifications were complete, the Qin forces heard of it and advanced with all their troops in full armor.

sentences.zh: 軍士許歷請以軍事諫，趙奢曰：「內之。」

translations.literal: Soldier Xu Li requested to advise on military matters, Zhao She said: 'Bring him in.'
translations.idiomatic: Soldier Xu Li requested to offer military advice. Zhao She said: 'Bring him in.'

sentences.zh: 許歷曰：「秦人不意趙師至此，其來氣盛，將軍必厚集其陣以待之。

translations.literal: Xu Li said: 'Qin did not expect Zhao troops to arrive here, their coming spirit strong, general must densely gather his formation to wait for them.
translations.idiomatic: Xu Li said: 'The Qin did not expect Zhao troops to arrive here. They come with high morale and spirit. General, you must concentrate your forces densely to meet them.

sentences.zh: 不然，必敗。」

translations.literal: If not, certainly defeat.'
translations.idiomatic: Otherwise, we will surely be defeated.'

sentences.zh: 趙奢曰：「請受令。」

translations.literal: Zhao She said: 'Please accept orders.'
translations.idiomatic: Zhao She said: 'I accept your advice.'

sentences.zh: 許歷曰：「請就鈇質之誅。」

translations.literal: Xu Li said: 'Please submit to axe block punishment.'
translations.idiomatic: Xu Li said: 'Please have me executed for offering unsolicited advice.'

sentences.zh: 趙奢曰：「胥後令邯鄲。」

translations.literal: Zhao She said: 'Wait until after, order Handan.'
translations.idiomatic: Zhao She said: 'Wait until after the battle. Then I'll report it to Handan.'

sentences.zh: 許歷復請諫，曰：「先據北山上者勝，後至者敗。」

translations.literal: Xu Li again requested to advise, said: 'Those who first occupy north mountain top win, those who arrive later defeat.'
translations.idiomatic: Xu Li again requested to offer advice: 'Whoever occupies the north mountain summit first will win; those who arrive later will be defeated.'

sentences.zh: 趙奢許諾，即發萬人趨之。

translations.literal: Zhao She agreed, immediately sent ten thousand men hurried to it.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao She agreed and immediately dispatched ten thousand men to hurry there.

sentences.zh: 秦兵後至，爭山不得上，趙奢縱兵擊之，大破秦軍。

translations.literal: Qin troops arrived later, contended for mountain could not ascend, Zhao She unleashed troops attacked them, greatly broke Qin army.
translations.idiomatic: The Qin troops arrived later and fought to ascend the mountain but could not. Zhao She unleashed his troops to attack them and routed the Qin army.

sentences.zh: 秦軍解而走，遂解閼與之圍而歸。

translations.literal: Qin army retreated and fled, thus lifted Yan siege and returned.
translations.idiomatic: The Qin army retreated in defeat, thus lifting the siege of Yan and withdrawing.

translations.literal: Troops departed Handan thirty li, then ordered in the army: 'Anyone who advises on military matters dies.' Qin army encamped west of Wuan. Qin army beat drums and shouted, mobilizing troops. Wuan's roof tiles all shook. Among the army a scout reported urgent rescue of Wuan. Zhao She immediately executed him. Held firm the walls, stayed twenty-eight days without advancing, moreover increased the fortifications. Qin spies came in, Zhao She fed them well and sent them away. The spies reported to Qin general, Qin general greatly pleased: 'Departed the state thirty li yet army does not advance, moreover increases fortifications. Yan is not Zhao territory.' Zhao She having sent away Qin spies, rolled up armor and rushed forward. In two days one night arrived, ordered good archers to encamp fifty li from Yan. Army fortifications completed. Qin heard of this, all armored and came. Soldier Xu Li requested to advise on military matters. Zhao She said: 'Enter.' Xu Li said: 'Qin does not expect Zhao troops to come here. They come with strong spirit. General must densely gather the array to wait for them. Otherwise, certainly defeated.' Zhao She said: 'Receive the command.' Xu Li said: 'Beg to submit to axe and awl punishment.' Zhao She said: 'Afterward command Handan.' Xu Li again requested to advise: 'First occupy the north mountain—the one above wins, later arrives defeated.' Zhao She agreed, immediately sent ten thousand to rush it. Qin troops arrived later, contended for the mountain could not ascend. Zhao She unleashed troops to attack them, greatly breaking Qin army. Qin army retreated and fled, thus lifted the Yan siege and returned.

sentences.zh: 趙惠文王賜奢號為馬服君，以許歷為國尉。

translations.literal: Zhao Hui Wen Wang granted She title Ma Fu Jun, made Xu Li state defender.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Hui Wen Wang granted Zhao She the title Lord Ma Fu and appointed Xu Li as state defender.

sentences.zh: 趙奢於是與廉頗、藺相如同位。

translations.literal: Zhao She thus with Lian Po, Lin Xiangru same rank.
translations.idiomatic: Thus Zhao She held the same rank as Lian Po and Lin Xiangru.

translations.literal: Zhao King Huiwen granted She the title Lord Ma Fu, appointed Xu Li as national defender. Zhao She thus with Lian Po and Lin Xiangru same position.

sentences.zh: 後四年，趙惠文王卒，子孝成王立。

translations.literal: After four years, Zhao Hui Wen Wang died, son Xiao Cheng Wang ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Four years later, Zhao Hui Wen Wang died and his son, King Xiao Cheng, ascended the throne.

sentences.zh: 七年，秦與趙兵相距長平，時趙奢已死，而藺相如病甐，趙使廉頗將攻秦，秦數敗趙軍，趙軍固壁不戰。

translations.literal: Seventh year, Qin with Zhao troops confronted at Changping, at time Zhao She already dead, Lin Xiangru illness severe, Zhao sent Lian Po to lead attack Qin, Qin repeatedly defeated Zhao army, Zhao army fortified walls not fight.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year, Qin and Zhao forces confronted each other at Changping. By this time Zhao She had died and Lin Xiangru was gravely ill. Zhao sent Lian Po to lead the attack on Qin, but Qin repeatedly defeated Zhao's forces. The Zhao army fortified their position and refused to fight.

sentences.zh: 秦數挑戰，廉頗不肯。

translations.literal: Qin repeatedly challenged, Lian Po not willing.
translations.idiomatic: Qin repeatedly issued challenges, but Lian Po refused to engage.

sentences.zh: 趙王信秦之閒。

translations.literal: Zhao king believed Qin spies.
translations.idiomatic: The Zhao king believed Qin's spies.

sentences.zh: 秦之閒言曰：「秦之所惡，獨畏馬服君趙奢之子趙括為將耳。」

translations.literal: Qin spies said: 'What Qin fears, only Ma Fu Jun Zhao She son Zhao Kuo as general.'
translations.idiomatic: Qin's spies spread word: 'What Qin truly fears is only that Lord Ma Fu's son, Zhao Kuo, might be appointed general.'

sentences.zh: 趙王因以括為將，代廉頗。

translations.literal: Zhao king thus made Kuo general, replaced Lian Po.
translations.idiomatic: The Zhao king therefore appointed Zhao Kuo as general to replace Lian Po.

sentences.zh: 藺相如曰：「王以名使括，若膠柱而鼓瑟耳。

translations.literal: Lin Xiangru said: 'King by reputation sends Kuo, like gluing zither pegs and playing zither.
translations.idiomatic: Lin Xiangru said: 'Your Majesty is appointing Zhao Kuo based on reputation alone. It's like gluing the pegs of a zither and trying to play it.

sentences.zh: 括徒能讀其父書傳，不知合變也。」

translations.literal: Kuo only can read his father books commentaries, does not know to adapt to changes.'
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Kuo can only recite his father's books and commentaries by rote. He doesn't know how to adapt to changing circumstances.'

sentences.zh: 趙王不聽，遂將之。

translations.literal: Zhao king not listen, thus sent him as general.
translations.idiomatic: The Zhao king would not listen and appointed him general anyway.

translations.literal: Four years later, Zhao King Huiwen died, son King Xiaocheng ascended. Seventh year, Qin and Zhao troops confronted at Changping. At this time Zhao She already dead, Lin Xiangru ill in bed. Zhao sent Lian Po to lead against Qin. Qin repeatedly defeated Zhao army. Zhao army held walls not fighting. Qin repeatedly challenged, Lian Po refused. The Zhao king believed Qin's rumors. Qin's rumors said: 'What Qin fears, only dreads Lord Ma Fu Zhao She's son Zhao Kuo as general.' The Zhao king thus appointed Kuo as general, replacing Lian Po. Lin Xiangru said: 'Your Majesty appoints Kuo by name, like gluing the tuning pegs and playing the zither. Kuo only can read his father's books and transmissions, does not know adapting to changes.' The Zhao king did not listen, thus sent him.

sentences.zh: 趙括自少時學兵法，言兵事，以天下莫能當。

translations.literal: Zhao Kuo from youth studied military strategy, spoke of military affairs, considered world none could match him.
translations.idiomatic: From a young age, Zhao Kuo studied military strategy and spoke of military affairs, believing no one in the world could match him.

sentences.zh: 嘗與其父奢言兵事，奢不能難，然不謂善。

translations.literal: Often with his father She discussed military affairs, She could not refute, but did not consider good.
translations.idiomatic: He often discussed military affairs with his father Zhao She, who could not refute him, but did not consider it good.

sentences.zh: 括母問奢其故，奢曰：「兵，死地也，而括易言之。

translations.literal: Kuo mother asked She the reason, She said: 'War is place of death, yet Kuo speaks of it lightly.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Kuo's mother asked Zhao She the reason. He said: 'War is a matter of life and death, yet Zhao Kuo speaks of it lightly.

sentences.zh: 使趙不將括即已，若必將之，破趙軍者必括也。」

translations.literal: If Zhao not makes Kuo general then fine, if must make him, the one who breaks Zhao army will certainly be Kuo.'
translations.idiomatic: If Zhao doesn't appoint Zhao Kuo as general, fine. But if they must appoint him, the one who destroys Zhao's army will certainly be Zhao Kuo himself.'

sentences.zh: 及括將行，其母上書言於王曰：「括不可使將。」

translations.literal: When Kuo was about to go, his mother submitted letter to king saying: 'Kuo cannot be made general.'
translations.idiomatic: When Zhao Kuo was about to depart, his mother submitted a letter to the king saying: 'Zhao Kuo cannot be made a general.'

sentences.zh: 王曰：「何以？」

translations.literal: King said: 'Why?'
translations.idiomatic: The king asked: 'Why?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「始妾事其父，時為將，身所奉飯飲而進食者以十數，所友者以百數，大王及宗室所賞賜者盡以予軍吏士大夫，受命之日，不問家事。

translations.literal: Replied: 'When I first served his father, when he was general, those he personally brought food and drink to feed numbered tens, those he befriended numbered hundreds, great king and royal family rewards all given to army officers and gentlemen, on day of receiving orders, did not ask about family matters.
translations.idiomatic: She replied: 'When I first served his father as general, he personally brought food and drink to feed dozens of men, befriended hundreds, gave all the king's and royal family's rewards to army officers and gentlemen. On the day he received orders, he never asked about family matters.

sentences.zh: 今括一旦為將，東向而朝，軍吏無敢仰視之者，王所賜金帛，歸藏於家，而日視便利田宅可買者買之。

translations.literal: Now Kuo suddenly becomes general, faces east and receives court, army officers none dare look up at him, king rewards of gold and silk, returns and stores at home, and daily looks for profitable fields and houses to buy.
translations.idiomatic: Now Zhao Kuo suddenly becomes general, faces east to receive court visits, army officers don't dare look up at him. He takes the king's rewards of gold and silk, returns home to store them, and daily looks for profitable fields and houses to buy.

sentences.zh: 王以為何如其父？

translations.literal: King consider how compared to his father?
translations.idiomatic: In your opinion, how does he compare to his father?

sentences.zh: 父子異心，願王勿遣。」

translations.literal: Father and son different hearts, wish king not send.'
translations.idiomatic: Father and son have different hearts. I beg you not to send him.'

sentences.zh: 王曰：「母置之，吾已決矣。」

translations.literal: King said: 'Mother let it go, I have already decided.'
translations.idiomatic: The king said: 'Mother, let it go. I have already decided.'

sentences.zh: 括母因曰：「王終遣之，即有如不稱，妾得無隨坐乎？」

translations.literal: Kuo mother thus said: 'King finally sends him, if there is as not worthy, may I not be implicated?'
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Kuo's mother then said: 'If the king insists on sending him, and if he proves unworthy, may I not be implicated?'

sentences.zh: 王許諾。

translations.literal: King promised.
translations.idiomatic: The king promised.

translations.literal: Zhao Kuo from youth studied military strategy, spoke of military affairs considering no one in the world could match him. Once discussed military affairs with his father She, She could not refute him, yet did not consider it good. Kuo's mother asked She the reason. She said: 'War is the place of death, yet Kuo speaks of it easily. If Zhao does not appoint Kuo then fine, if must appoint him, the one who breaks Zhao army must be Kuo.' When Kuo was about to go, his mother presented a letter to the king saying: 'Kuo cannot be made general.' The king said: 'Why?' She replied: 'At first I served his father. When he was general, those who presented food and drink to him numbered dozens, those he befriended numbered hundreds. What the great king and royal clan granted as rewards he all gave to army officers and scholars. On the day he received command, did not ask family matters. Now Kuo once becomes general, faces east for court audience. Army officers dare not look up at him. What the king grants gold and silk, he takes home and stores, daily looks at profitable fields and houses to buy.' The king considers how compared to his father? Father and son different hearts. I hope Your Majesty does not send him.' The king said: 'Mother set it aside, I have already decided.' Kuo's mother thus said: 'Your Majesty ultimately sends him, if he does not match expectations, may I not be implicated?' The king agreed.

sentences.zh: 趙括既代廉頗，悉更約束，易置軍吏。

translations.literal: Zhao Kuo having replaced Lian Po, all changed regulations, replaced army officers.
translations.idiomatic: Once Zhao Kuo replaced Lian Po, he changed all the regulations and replaced the army officers.

sentences.zh: 秦將白起聞之，縱奇兵，詳敗走，而絕其糧道，分斷其軍為二，士卒離心。

translations.literal: Qin general Bai Qi heard, unleashed surprise troops, pretended defeat fled, cut their grain route, divided their army into two, soldiers hearts estranged.
translations.idiomatic: Qin general Bai Qi heard this and unleashed surprise troops. He pretended to be defeated and flee, cutting their grain supply routes and dividing their army into two. The soldiers' morale collapsed.

sentences.zh: 四十餘日，軍餓，趙括出銳卒自博戰，秦軍射殺趙括。

translations.literal: Forty plus days, army hungry, Zhao Kuo sent sharp troops to fight personally, Qin army shot killed Zhao Kuo.
translations.idiomatic: After forty-plus days, the army was starving. Zhao Kuo led elite troops out to fight personally, and the Qin army shot and killed Zhao Kuo.

sentences.zh: 括軍敗，數十萬之眾遂降秦，秦悉阬之。

translations.literal: Kuo army defeated, several tens of thousands crowd thus surrendered Qin, Qin all buried them alive.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Kuo's army was defeated, and the several hundred thousand troops surrendered to Qin. Qin buried them all alive.

sentences.zh: 趙前後所亡凡四十五萬。

translations.literal: Zhao before and after lost altogether forty-five thousand.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao lost a total of 450,000 men before and after.

sentences.zh: 明年，秦兵遂圍邯鄲，歲餘，幾不得脫。

translations.literal: Next year, Qin troops thus surrounded Handan, over a year, almost could not escape.
translations.idiomatic: The next year, Qin troops surrounded Handan. After more than a year, they almost couldn't escape.

sentences.zh: 賴楚、魏諸侯來救，乃得解邯鄲之圍。

translations.literal: Relied on Chu, Wei feudal lords came to rescue, thus able to lift Handan siege.
translations.idiomatic: Thanks to Chu and Wei lords coming to their rescue, they were able to lift the siege of Handan.

sentences.zh: 趙王亦以括母先言，竟不誅也。

translations.literal: Zhao king also because Kuo mother previous words, ultimately did not execute her.
translations.idiomatic: The Zhao king, because of Zhao Kuo's mother's earlier warning, ultimately did not execute her.

translations.literal: Zhao Kuo having replaced Lian Po, completely changed the regulations, replaced army officers. Qin general Bai Qi heard of this, sent surprise troops, pretended defeat and retreat, cut their grain routes, divided their army into two, soldiers' hearts separated. Over forty days, army hungry. Zhao Kuo sent sharp troops to fight singly. Qin army shot and killed Zhao Kuo. Kuo's army defeated, several hundred thousand troops surrendered to Qin. Qin buried them all alive. Zhao previously and afterward lost altogether 450,000. The next year, Qin troops besieged Handan. Over a year, nearly could not escape. Relying on Chu and Wei feudal lords coming to rescue, then lifted Handan's siege. The Zhao king also because Kuo's mother previously spoke, ultimately did not execute her.

sentences.zh: 自邯鄲圍解五年，而燕用栗腹之謀，曰「趙壯者盡於長平，其孤未壯」，舉兵擊趙。

translations.literal: From Handan siege lifted five years, Yan used Li Fu strategy, said 'Zhao strong ones exhausted at Changping, their orphans not yet grown', raised troops attacked Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: Five years after the Handan siege was lifted, Yan followed Li Fu's strategy, saying 'Zhao's strong men were all exhausted at Changping, their orphans are not yet grown,' and raised troops to attack Zhao.

sentences.zh: 趙使廉頗將，擊，大破燕軍於鄗，殺栗腹，遂圍燕。

translations.literal: Zhao sent Lian Po as general, attacked, greatly broke Yan army at Hao, killed Li Fu, thus surrounded Yan.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao sent Lian Po as general. He attacked, routed the Yan army at Hao, killed Li Fu, and surrounded Yan.

sentences.zh: 燕割五城請和，乃聽之。

translations.literal: Yan cut five cities requested peace, thus listened to it.
translations.idiomatic: Yan ceded five cities and requested peace, and Zhao accepted.

sentences.zh: 趙以尉文封廉頗為信平君，為假相國。

translations.literal: Zhao with Wei Wen enfeoffed Lian Po as Xin Ping Jun, made acting prime minister.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao enfeoffed Lian Po as Lord Xin Ping with Wei Wen, and made him acting prime minister.

translations.literal: From Handan's siege lifted five years, Yan used Li Fu's plan, saying 'Zhao's strong men exhausted at Changping, their orphans not yet grown', raised troops to attack Zhao. Zhao sent Lian Po to lead, attacked, greatly broke Yan army at Gao, killed Li Fu, then besieged Yan. Yan ceded five cities to request peace, then heeded it. Zhao with Wei Wen enfeoffed Lian Po as Lord Xinping, as deputy prime minister.

sentences.zh: 廉頗之免長平歸也，失勢之時，故客盡去。

translations.literal: Lian Po dismissed from Changping returned, time of lost power, old guests all left.
translations.idiomatic: When Lian Po was dismissed from Changping and returned home, during his time out of power, all his old guests left him.

sentences.zh: 及復用為將，客又復至。

translations.literal: When again used as general, guests again came.
translations.idiomatic: When he was again appointed general, the guests came back again.

sentences.zh: 廉頗曰：「客退矣！」

translations.literal: Lian Po said: 'Guests leave!'
translations.idiomatic: Lian Po said: 'The guests have left!'

sentences.zh: 客曰：「吁！

translations.literal: Guest said: 'Alas!
translations.idiomatic: The guest said: 'Alas!

sentences.zh: 君何見之晚也？

translations.literal: Lord why see it late?
translations.idiomatic: Why do you only realize this now?'

sentences.zh: 夫天下以市道交，君有勢，我則從君，君無勢則去，此固其理也，有何怨乎？」

translations.literal: World with marketplace way associates, lord has power, I then follow lord, lord no power then leave, this indeed its principle, have what resentment?'
translations.idiomatic: The world associates like the marketplace. When you have power, I follow you. When you have no power, I leave. This is simply the principle of things. Why resent it?'

sentences.zh: 居六年，趙使廉頗伐魏之繁陽，拔之。

translations.literal: Stayed six years, Zhao sent Lian Po attacked Wei Fanyang, took it.
translations.idiomatic: Six years later, Zhao sent Lian Po to attack Wei's Fanyang and captured it.

translations.literal: When Lian Po was dismissed from Changping and returned, in the time of lost power, retainers all left. When again used as general, retainers again came. Lian Po said: 'Retainers gone!' Retainers said: 'Ah! Why does my lord see this so late? The world befriends by marketplace principles. You have power, I follow you. You have no power then leave. This is certainly the principle. What resentment?' Six years later, Zhao sent Lian Po to attack Wei's Fanyang, capturing it.

sentences.zh: 趙孝成王卒，子悼襄王立，使樂乘代廉頗。

translations.literal: Zhao Xiao Cheng Wang died, son Dao Xiang Wang ascended, sent Yue Cheng replaced Lian Po.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Xiao Cheng Wang died, and his son King Dao Xiang ascended the throne. He sent Yue Cheng to replace Lian Po.

sentences.zh: 廉頗怒，攻樂乘，樂乘走。

translations.literal: Lian Po angered, attacked Yue Cheng, Yue Cheng fled.
translations.idiomatic: Lian Po was furious and attacked Yue Cheng, who fled.

sentences.zh: 廉頗遂奔魏之大梁。

translations.literal: Lian Po thus fled to Wei Daxiang.
translations.idiomatic: Lian Po then fled to Wei's Daxiang.

sentences.zh: 其明年，趙乃以李牧為將而攻燕，拔武遂、方城。

translations.literal: Next year, Zhao then with Li Mu as general attacked Yan, took Wu Sui, Fang Cheng.
translations.idiomatic: The next year, Zhao appointed Li Mu as general to attack Yan, capturing Wu Sui and Fang Cheng.

translations.literal: Zhao King Xiaocheng died, son King Dao Xiang ascended, sent Yue Cheng to replace Lian Po. Lian Po angered, attacked Yue Cheng. Yue Cheng fled. Lian Po thus fled to Wei's Daliang. The next year, Zhao appointed Li Mu as general to attack Yan, capturing Wushui and Fangcheng.

sentences.zh: 廉頗居梁久之，魏不能信用。

translations.literal: Lian Po dwelt Liang long time, Wei could not employ him.
translations.idiomatic: Lian Po lived in Liang for a long time, but Wei could not find employment for him.

sentences.zh: 趙以數困於秦兵，趙王思復得廉頗，廉頗亦思復用於趙。

translations.literal: Zhao repeatedly troubled by Qin troops, Zhao king thought again get Lian Po, Lian Po also thought again used by Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao was repeatedly troubled by Qin troops. The Zhao king longed to have Lian Po again, and Lian Po also longed to be employed by Zhao once more.

sentences.zh: 趙王使使者視廉頗尚可用否。

translations.literal: Zhao king sent envoy see Lian Po still usable or not.
translations.idiomatic: The Zhao king sent an envoy to see if Lian Po was still usable.

sentences.zh: 廉頗之仇郭開多與使者金，令毀之。

translations.literal: Lian Po enemy Guo Kai gave much envoy gold, ordered slander him.
translations.idiomatic: Lian Po's enemy Guo Kai gave much gold to the envoy and ordered him to slander Lian Po.

sentences.zh: 趙使者既見廉頗，廉頗為之一飯斗米，肉十斤，被甲上馬，以示尚可用。

translations.literal: Zhao envoy having seen Lian Po, Lian Po for him ate one meal dou rice, meat ten jin, donned armor mounted horse, to show still usable.
translations.idiomatic: The Zhao envoy, having seen Lian Po, watched as Lian Po ate a dou of rice and ten jin of meat in one meal, then donned his armor and mounted his horse, to show he was still usable.

sentences.zh: 趙使還報王曰：「廉將軍雖老，尚善飯，然與臣坐，頃之三遺矢矣。」

translations.literal: Zhao envoy returned reported king: 'Lian general though old, still eats well, but sat with minister, moment three times defecated.'
translations.idiomatic: The Zhao envoy returned and reported to the king: 'General Lian is old, but he still eats well. However, while sitting with me, he defecated three times in a moment.'

sentences.zh: 趙王以為老，遂不召。

translations.literal: Zhao king considered old, thus did not summon.
translations.idiomatic: The Zhao king considered him too old and did not summon him.

translations.literal: Lian Po resided in Wei for long, Wei could not employ him. Zhao repeatedly troubled by Qin troops, the Zhao king thought of again obtaining Lian Po. Lian Po also thought of again being used in Zhao. The Zhao king sent envoys to see if Lian Po still usable. Lian Po's enemy Guo Kai gave much gold to the envoys, ordered them to slander him. Zhao envoys having seen Lian Po, Lian Po for them ate one dou of rice, ten jin of meat, donned armor and mounted horse, to show still usable. Zhao envoys returned reported to king: 'Lian general though old, still eats well, but sitting with me, in a moment relieved himself three times.' The Zhao king considered him old, thus did not summon.

sentences.zh: 楚聞廉頗在魏，陰使人迎之。

translations.literal: Chu heard Lian Po in Wei, secretly sent people welcome him.
translations.idiomatic: Chu heard Lian Po was in Wei and secretly sent people to welcome him.

sentences.zh: 廉頗一為楚將，無功，曰：「我思用趙人。」

translations.literal: Lian Po once became Chu general, no merit, said: 'I think use Zhao people.'
translations.idiomatic: Lian Po once became a Chu general but achieved no merit. He said: 'I long to use Zhao troops.'

sentences.zh: 廉頗卒死于壽春。

translations.literal: Lian Po finally died in Shouchun.
translations.idiomatic: Lian Po finally died in Shouchun.

translations.literal: Chu heard Lian Po in Wei, secretly sent people to welcome him. Lian Po once became Chu general, no merit, said: 'I think of using Zhao people.' Lian Po ultimately died in Shouchun.

sentences.zh: 李牧者，趙之北邊良將也。

translations.literal: Li Mu was Zhao northern border good general.
translations.idiomatic: Li Mu was Zhao's excellent northern border general.

sentences.zh: 常居代鴈門，備匈奴。

translations.literal: Often dwelt Dai Yanmen, prepared against Xiongnu.
translations.idiomatic: He often resided in Dai and Yanmen, preparing against the Xiongnu.

sentences.zh: 以便宜置吏，市租皆輸入莫府，為士卒費。

translations.literal: Used expediency placed officials, market rents all entered Mo residence, for soldiers expenses.
translations.idiomatic: He appointed officials as needed and had all market rents enter the commander's residence to fund the soldiers' expenses.

sentences.zh: 日擊數牛饗士，習射騎，謹烽火，多閒諜，厚遇戰士。

translations.literal: Daily slaughtered several oxen feasted soldiers, practiced archery riding, careful beacon fires, many secret spies, generously treated warriors.
translations.idiomatic: Daily he slaughtered several oxen to feast the soldiers, practiced archery and riding, was careful with beacon fires, employed many secret spies, and generously treated the warriors.

sentences.zh: 為約曰：「匈奴即入盜，急入收保，有敢捕虜者斬。」

translations.literal: Made agreement: 'Xiongnu if enter raid, urgently enter gather protect, have dare capture captives decapitate.'
translations.idiomatic: He made a rule: 'When the Xiongnu enter to raid, urgently gather and protect the people. Anyone who dares capture captives will be executed.'

sentences.zh: 匈奴每入，烽火謹，輒入收保，不敢戰。

translations.literal: Xiongnu each enter, beacon fires careful, then enter gather protect, dared not fight.
translations.idiomatic: Whenever the Xiongnu entered, the beacon fires were carefully lit, and the people gathered for protection without daring to fight.

sentences.zh: 如是數歲，亦不亡失。

translations.literal: Like this several years, also no losses.
translations.idiomatic: Like this for several years, with no losses or defeats.

sentences.zh: 然匈奴以李牧為怯，雖趙邊兵亦以為吾將怯。

translations.literal: But Xiongnu considered Li Mu cowardly, even Zhao border troops also considered our general cowardly.
translations.idiomatic: However, the Xiongnu considered Li Mu cowardly, and even Zhao's border troops thought their general was cowardly.

sentences.zh: 趙王讓李牧，李牧如故。

translations.literal: Zhao king rebuked Li Mu, Li Mu as before.
translations.idiomatic: The Zhao king rebuked Li Mu, but Li Mu continued as before.

sentences.zh: 趙王怒，召之，使他人代將。

translations.literal: Zhao king angered, summoned him, made other person replace general.
translations.idiomatic: The Zhao king grew angry, summoned him back, and had someone else replace him as general.

translations.literal: Li Mu was Zhao's fine northern border general. Often resided in Dai and Yanmen, defending against Xiongnu. With discretion appointed officials, market rents all entered the headquarters, for soldiers' expenses. Daily slaughtered several oxen to feast soldiers, practiced archery and riding, careful with beacon fires, many spies, generously treated warriors. Made agreement: 'If Xiongnu enter to plunder, urgently enter and defend. Anyone who dares capture captives executed.' Xiongnu whenever entered, beacon fires careful, then entered and defended, dared not fight. Like this several years, also no losses. Yet Xiongnu considered Li Mu cowardly. Even Zhao border soldiers considered our general cowardly. Zhao king rebuked Li Mu. Li Mu as before. Zhao king angered, summoned him, made others replace as general.

sentences.zh: 歲餘，匈奴每來，出戰。

translations.literal: Year plus, Xiongnu each come, went out fought.
translations.idiomatic: Over a year, whenever the Xiongnu came, they went out to fight.

sentences.zh: 出戰，數不利，失亡多，邊不得田畜。

translations.literal: Went out fought, several times unfavorable, losses many, border could not farm herd.
translations.idiomatic: When they went out to fight, they were defeated several times, with heavy losses. The border regions could no longer farm or herd.

sentences.zh: 復請李牧。

translations.literal: Again requested Li Mu.
translations.idiomatic: They again requested Li Mu.

sentences.zh: 牧杜門不出，固稱疾。

translations.literal: Mu blocked door not out, firmly claimed illness.
translations.idiomatic: Li Mu shut his door and refused to come out, firmly claiming illness.

sentences.zh: 趙王乃復彊起使將兵。

translations.literal: Zhao king then again strongly raised made him lead troops.
translations.idiomatic: The Zhao king then strongly insisted on raising him to lead troops again.

sentences.zh: 牧曰：「王必用臣，臣如前，乃敢奉令。」

translations.literal: Mu said: 'King if must use minister, minister like before, then dares receive orders.'
translations.idiomatic: Li Mu said: 'If the king must use me, then I must do things as before before I dare accept orders.'

sentences.zh: 王許之。

translations.literal: King allowed it.
translations.idiomatic: The king agreed.

translations.literal: Over a year, Xiongnu whenever came, went out to fight. Went out to fight, repeatedly unfavorable, losses many, border could not farm or herd. Again requested Li Mu. Mu shut doors not going out, firmly claimed illness. Zhao king then strongly raised him to lead troops. Mu said: 'Your Majesty must use me, I as before, then dare accept command.' King agreed.

sentences.zh: 李牧至，如故約。

translations.literal: Li Mu arrived, like former agreement.
translations.idiomatic: When Li Mu arrived, he followed the old agreement.

sentences.zh: 匈奴數歲無所得。

translations.literal: Xiongnu several years no gains.
translations.idiomatic: For several years the Xiongnu gained nothing.

sentences.zh: 終以為怯。

translations.literal: Ultimately considered cowardly.
translations.idiomatic: They ultimately considered him cowardly.

sentences.zh: 邊士日得賞賜而不用，皆願一戰。

translations.literal: Border soldiers daily got rewards but not used, all wished one battle.
translations.idiomatic: The border soldiers received daily rewards but were not used in battle, so all wished for one fight.

sentences.zh: 於是乃具選車得千三百乘，選騎得萬三千匹，百金之士五萬人，彀者十萬人，悉勒習戰。

translations.literal: Thus then fully selected chariots got thirteen hundred teams, selected cavalry got thirteen thousand horses, hundred gold warriors fifty thousand men, archers one hundred thousand men, all prepared practiced battle.
translations.idiomatic: Thus he fully selected 1,300 chariots, 13,000 cavalry horses, 50,000 elite warriors worth a hundred gold each, and 100,000 archers. All were prepared and drilled in battle.

sentences.zh: 大縱畜牧，人民滿野。

translations.literal: Greatly let loose livestock, people filled fields.
translations.idiomatic: He greatly released livestock and let the people fill the fields.

sentences.zh: 匈奴小入，詳北不勝，以數千人委之。

translations.literal: Xiongnu small entry, pretended north not victorious, with several thousand abandoned them.
translations.idiomatic: When a small Xiongnu force entered, they pretended to be defeated northward and abandoned several thousand men to them.

sentences.zh: 單于聞之，大率眾來入。

translations.literal: Chanyu heard, greatly led masses came entered.
translations.idiomatic: When the Chanyu heard this, he led his great host to invade.

sentences.zh: 李牧多為奇陳，張左右翼擊之，大破殺匈奴十餘萬騎。

translations.literal: Li Mu many made surprise formations, stretched left right wings attacked them, greatly broke killed Xiongnu ten plus ten thousand cavalry.
translations.idiomatic: Li Mu arranged many surprise formations, extended left and right wings to attack them, and routed the Xiongnu, killing over 100,000 cavalry.

sentences.zh: 滅襜襤，破東胡，降林胡，單于奔走。

translations.literal: Extinguished Chanlan, broke Donghu, surrendered Linhu, Chanyu fled.
translations.idiomatic: He extinguished the Chanlan, defeated the Donghu, subjugated the Linhu, and the Chanyu fled in defeat.

sentences.zh: 其後十餘歲，匈奴不敢近趙邊城。

translations.literal: Thereafter ten plus years, Xiongnu dared not approach Zhao border cities.
translations.idiomatic: For over ten years thereafter, the Xiongnu dared not approach Zhao's border cities.

translations.literal: Li Mu arrived, as former agreement. Xiongnu several years without gains. Ultimately considered him cowardly. Border soldiers daily received rewards without use, all wished one battle. Thus selected chariots getting 1,300, selected cavalry getting 13,000 horses, soldiers of hundred jin 50,000 men, archers 100,000 men, all harnessed and practiced battle. Greatly released livestock grazing, people filled the wilds. Xiongnu small entry, pretended north not winning, abandoning several thousand to them. Chanyu heard of this, greatly led masses to enter. Li Mu made many surprise formations, stretched left and right wings to attack them, greatly broke and killed Xiongnu over 100,000 cavalry. Destroyed Chanlan, broke Donghu, surrendered Linhu. Chanyu fled. Afterward over ten years, Xiongnu dared not approach Zhao border cities.

sentences.zh: 趙悼襄王元年，廉頗既亡入魏，趙使李牧攻燕，拔武遂、方城。

translations.literal: Zhao Dao Xiang Wang first year, Lian Po having fled entered Wei, Zhao sent Li Mu attacked Yan, took Wu Sui, Fang Cheng.
translations.idiomatic: In the first year of Zhao King Dao Xiang, after Lian Po had fled to Wei, Zhao sent Li Mu to attack Yan and captured Wu Sui and Fang Cheng.

sentences.zh: 居二年，龐煖破燕軍，殺劇辛。

translations.literal: Stayed two years, Pang Juan broke Yan army, killed Ju Xin.
translations.idiomatic: Two years later, Pang Juan defeated the Yan army and killed Ju Xin.

sentences.zh: 後七年，秦破殺趙將扈輒於武遂，斬首十萬。

translations.literal: After seven years, Qin broke killed Zhao general Hu Zhe at Wu Sui, beheaded ten thousand.
translations.idiomatic: Seven years later, Qin defeated and killed Zhao general Hu Zhe at Wu Sui, taking ten thousand heads.

sentences.zh: 趙乃以李牧為大將軍，擊秦軍於宜安，大破秦軍，走秦將桓齮。

translations.literal: Zhao then with Li Mu as grand general, attacked Qin army at Yi An, greatly broke Qin army, routed Qin general Huan Yi.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao then appointed Li Mu as grand general. He attacked the Qin army at Yi An, routed them, and put Qin general Huan Yi to flight.

sentences.zh: 封李牧為武安君。

translations.literal: Enfeoffed Li Mu as Wu An Jun.
translations.idiomatic: Li Mu was enfeoffed as Lord Wu An.

sentences.zh: 居三年，秦攻番吾，李牧擊破秦軍，南距韓、魏。

translations.literal: Stayed three years, Qin attacked Fan Wu, Li Mu struck broke Qin army, south confronted Han, Wei.
translations.idiomatic: Three years later, Qin attacked Fan Wu. Li Mu struck and defeated the Qin army, confronting Han and Wei to the south.

translations.literal: Zhao King Dao Xiang first year, Lian Po having fled to Wei, Zhao sent Li Mu to attack Yan, capturing Wushui and Fangcheng. Two years later, Pang Juan broke Yan army, killed Ju Xin. Seven years later, Qin broke and killed Zhao general Hu Che at Wushui, beheaded 100,000. Zhao appointed Li Mu as grand general, attacked Qin army at Yian, greatly broke Qin army, routed Qin general Huan Yan. Enfeoffed Li Mu as Lord Wuan. Three years later, Qin attacked Fanwu. Li Mu attacked and broke Qin army, southward opposed Han and Wei.

sentences.zh: 趙王遷七年，秦使王翦攻趙，趙使李牧、司馬尚御之。

translations.literal: Zhao Wang Qian seventh year, Qin sent Wang Jian attacked Zhao, Zhao sent Li Mu, Sima Shang defended against them.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year of Zhao King Qian, Qin sent Wang Jian to attack Zhao. Zhao sent Li Mu and Sima Shang to defend against him.

sentences.zh: 秦多與趙王寵臣郭開金，為反閒，言李牧、司馬尚欲反。

translations.literal: Qin much gave Zhao king favorite minister Guo Kai gold, made reverse spies, said Li Mu, Sima Shang wished to rebel.
translations.idiomatic: Qin gave much gold to Zhao king's favorite minister Guo Kai to act as a reverse spy, claiming that Li Mu and Sima Shang wished to rebel.

sentences.zh: 趙王乃使趙蔥及齊將顏聚代李牧。

translations.literal: Zhao king then sent Zhao Cong and Qi general Yan Ju replaced Li Mu.
translations.idiomatic: The Zhao king then sent Zhao Cong and Qi general Yan Ju to replace Li Mu.

sentences.zh: 李牧不受命，趙使人微捕得李牧，斬之。

translations.literal: Li Mu not accepted orders, Zhao sent people secretly arrested Li Mu, beheaded him.
translations.idiomatic: Li Mu refused the orders. Zhao sent people to secretly arrest and behead him.

sentences.zh: 廢司馬尚。

translations.literal: Dismissed Sima Shang.
translations.idiomatic: Sima Shang was dismissed.

sentences.zh: 後三月，王翦因急擊趙，大破殺趙蔥，虜趙王遷及其將顏聚，遂滅趙。

translations.literal: After three months, Wang Jian thus urgently attacked Zhao, greatly broke killed Zhao Cong, captured Zhao Wang Qian and his general Yan Ju, thus extinguished Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: Three months later, Wang Jian urgently attacked Zhao, routed and killed Zhao Cong, captured King Qian of Zhao and his general Yan Ju, thus destroying Zhao.

translations.literal: Zhao King Qian seventh year, Qin sent Wang Jian to attack Zhao. Zhao sent Li Mu and Sima Shang to resist them. Qin gave much gold to Zhao king's favorite minister Guo Kai, for sowing discord, saying Li Mu and Sima Shang wished to rebel. Zhao king sent Zhao Cong and Qi general Yan Ju to replace Li Mu. Li Mu did not accept command. Zhao sent people secretly captured Li Mu, executed him. Dismissed Sima Shang. Three months later, Wang Jian urgently attacked Zhao, greatly broke and killed Zhao Cong, captured Zhao King Qian and his general Yan Ju, thus extinguished Zhao.

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：知死必勇，非死者難也，處死者難。

translations.literal: Grand Historian said: Knowing death must be brave, not dying is not difficult, facing death is difficult.
translations.idiomatic: Grand Historian says: One who knows death will come must be brave. It is not difficult not to die; it is difficult to face death.

sentences.zh: 方藺相如引璧睨柱，及叱秦王左右，勢不過誅，然士或怯懦而不敢發。

translations.literal: When Lin Xiangru drew bi glared pillar, and berated Qin king attendants, situation no more than execution, but scholars or cowardly not dared act.
translations.idiomatic: When Lin Xiangru drew the bi and glared at the pillar, and berated the Qin king's attendants, the situation meant no more than execution. Yet some scholars are cowardly and dare not act.

sentences.zh: 相如一奮其氣，威信敵國，退而讓頗，名重太山，其處智勇，可謂兼之矣！

translations.literal: Xiangru one exerted his spirit, awed trusted enemy state, retreated yielded to Po, name heavy Mount Tai, his placing wisdom bravery, can be called combined them!
translations.idiomatic: Xiangru exerted his spirit once, awed and earned the trust of an enemy state. He retreated and yielded to Lian Po, his name heavier than Mount Tai. His handling of wisdom and bravery can be said to combine them all!

translations.literal: The Grand Historian says: Knowing death must be brave—not dying is difficult, facing death is difficult. When Lin Xiangru held the jade disk glaring at the pillar, and berated the Qin king's attendants, the situation no more than execution. Yet scholars or cowardly and dare not act. Xiangru once aroused his spirit, awed and trusted the enemy state. Retired and yielded to Lian Po, name heavy as Mount Tai. His wisdom and courage can be called combined!
